channel.title: Harshit Walia - Software Developer
channel.description: I'm a developer aiming to build things that spark joy. I build fun stuff on the web, and sometimes write about it.

item.title: What Software Craftsmanship is about?
item.description: Why is there a software craftsmanship movement? What motivated it? What drives it now?

item.title: Open Source x Free Software: What's the difference?
item.description: Learn the difference between these two terms that often get mixed up.

item.title: The purpose of this blog
item.description: Why does it exist?

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Dream, dream, dream, Your dreams will transform into thoughts Thoughts lead to honest work Work will result in action And you will succeed.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Any country is as good as its citizen; their ethos, their values and their character will be reflected in the country’s make-up.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Each one of us on this planet creates a page in human history irrespective of who he or she is. I realise my experience is a small dot in human history, but that dot has a life and light.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Man's Abiding happiness is not in getting anything but in giving himself up to what is greater than himself to ideas which are larger than his individual self the idea of his country of humanity of God.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Do Not say It is morning and dismiss it with a name of yesterday see of for the first time as a new-born child that has no name.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Let your life lightly dance on the edges of time like dew on the tip of leaf.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Everything comes to us that belongs to us if we create the capacity to receive it.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: With begging and scrambling we find very little but with being true to ourselves we find a great deal more.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Providence expects that we should make this world our own and not live in it as though it were a rented tenant we can only make it our own through some service and that service is to lend oit love and beauty from our soul.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: I Slept and dreamt that life was joy I awoke and saw that life was service I acted and behold service joy.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The meaning of our self is not to be found in its separateness from god and others but in the ceaseless realisation of yoga of union.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The higher the proportion of creative leaders in a nation, higher the potential of success of visions like “Developed India”.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The same stream of life that runs through my veins night and day runs through thw world and dances in rhythmic measures.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: We gain freedom whtn we have paid the full price for our right to live.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Asks the Possible of the impossible 'Where is your dwelling-place?' 'In the dreams the impotent' comes the answer.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Beauty is truth's smile when she beholds her own face in perfect mirror.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: In love all the contradiction of existence merge themselves and are lost only in love are unity and duality not at variance love must be one and two at the same time bondage and liberation are not antagonistic in love for love is most free and at thesame time most bound.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Not hammer strokes but dance of the water sings the pebbles into perfection.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: I have spent my days stringing and unstringing my instrument while the song I came to sing remains unsung.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The butterfly counts not months but has time enough.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The emancipation of our physical nature is in attaining health of our social being in attaining goodness and of our self in attaining love.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The potentiality of perfection outweighs actual contradictions.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Success is possible only when we have a commitment to action.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The fundamental desire of life is the desire to exist.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The most important lesson that man can learn from his life is not that there is pain in this world but that it depends upon him to turn in into good account that it is possible for him to transmute it into joy.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The water in a vessel is sparkling the water in the sea is dark the small truth has words which are clear the great truth has great silence.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Whatever we treasure for ourselves separates us from others Our possessions are our limitations.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Don't limit a child to your own learning for he was born in another time.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Death belongs to life as birth does the walk is in the raising of the foot as in the laying of it down.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Facts are many but the truth is one.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: To understand anything is to find in it something which is our own, and it is the discovery of ourselves outside us which makes us glad this relation of understanding is partial but the relation of love is complete.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The mountain remains unmoved at seeming defeat by the mist.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The tragedy of human life consists in our vain attempts to stretch the limits of things which can never become unlimited and to reach the infinite by absurdly adding to the rungs of the ladder of the finite.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: While moral leadership requires people to do the right things, entrepreneurial leadership requires people to acquire the habit of doing things right.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Those who have everything but thee my god laugh at those who have nothing but thyself.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The revealment of the infinite in the finite which is the motive of the all creation is not seen in its perfection in the starry heavens in the beauty of the flowers it is in the soul of man.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: In its swelling pride the bubble doubts the truth of the sea and laughs and bursts into emptiness.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The greed for fruit misses the flower.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: To justify their own spilling of ink they spell the day as night.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: My clouds sorrowing in the dark forget that they themselves have hidden the sun.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: I am bale to love god because he gives me freedom to deny him.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Wealth is the burden of bigness welfare the fulness of being.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Connectivity is strength Connectivity is wealth Connectivity is progress.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: To Carry the burden of the instrument count the cost of its material and never to know that it is for music is the tragedy of deaf life.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Open the door to that which must go for the loss becomes unseemly when obstructed.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The tapestry of life's story is woven with the threads of life's ties ever joining and breaking.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: In my life's garden my wealth has been of the shadows and lights that are never gathered and stored.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Profit smiles on goodness when the good is profitable.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Man discovers his own wealth when god comes to ask gifts of him.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The worm thinks it strange and foolish that man does not eat his books.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The sky remains infinitely vacant for earth there to build its heaven with dreams.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Life sends up in blades of grass its silent hymn of praise to the unnamed light.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Perception of disability lies in the mind.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Let me not grope in vain in the dark but keep my mind still in the faith that the day will break and truth will appear in its simplicity.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Let me light my lamp says the star and never debate if it will help to remove the darkness.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: In the mountain stillness surges up to explore its own height in the lake movement stands still to contemplate its own depth.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Let me not pray to be sheltered from dangers but to be fearless in facing them let me not beg for the stilling of my pain but for the heart to conquer it let me not loo for allies in life's battlefield but to my own strength let me not cave in.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Age considers youth ventures.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: TWhile god waits for his temple to be built love men bring stones.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The burden of self is lightened when i laugh at myself.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Clouds come floating into my life no longer to carry rain or usher storm but to add colour to my sunset sky.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Every child comes with the message that god is not yet discouraged of man.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: These paper boats of mine are meant to dance on the ripples of hours and not to reach any destination.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: When learning is purposeful, creativity blossoms When creativity blossoms thinking emanates When thinking emanates knowledge is lit When knowledge is lit the nation progresses.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The sea of danger doubt and denial around man's little island of certainty challenges him to dare the unknown .

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Hills are the Earth's gesture of despair for the unreachable.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: To be outspoken is easy when you do not wait to speak the complete truth.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Welcome nearest to the great when we are great in humility.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Trees are Earth's endless efforts to speak to the listening heavens.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Taking shelter in the dead is death itself and only taking all the risk of life to the fullest extent is living.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: You can't cross the sea merely by standing and staring ar the water.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The touch of an infinite mystery passes over the trivial and the familiar making it break out into ineffable music the trees the stars and the stars and the blue hills ache with a meaning which can never be uttered in words.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The soil in return for her service keeps the tree tied to her the sky asks noting and leaves it free.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: A mind all logic is like a knife all blade it makes the hand bleed that uses it.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: With determined efforts you can always succeed against established beliefs.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Death is not extinguishing the light it is putting out the lamp because the dawn has come.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: He who wants to do good knocks at the gate he who loves finds the gate open.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The touch of an infinite mystery passes over the trivial and the familiar making it break out into ineffable music the trees the stars and the stars and the blue hills ache with a meaning which can never be uttered in words.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Want of love is a degree of callousness for love is the perfection of consciousness we do not comprehend or rather we do not comprehend because we do not love for love is the ultimate meaning of everything around us, it is not a mere sentiment it is truth it is the joy that is at the root of all creation.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: If you shut your door to all errors truth will be shut out.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: If anger be the basis of our political activities the excitement tends to become an end in itself at the expense of the object to be achieved such excitement is not an exercise of strength but a display of weakness.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: IN the night we stumble over things and become acutely conscious of their separateness but the day reveals the unity which embraces them.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: In our desire for eternal life we pray for an eternity of our habit and comfort forgetting that immortality is in repeatedly transcending the definite forms of life in order to pursue the infinite of life.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Our nature is obscured by work done by the compulsion of want or fear the mother reveals herself in the service of heer children so our true freedom is in action which can only be attained in the work of love.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Love does not claim possession but gives freedom.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Always be ready to walk the unexplored path.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: If life's journey be endless where is its goal the answer is it is everywhere we are in a palace which has no end but which we have reached by exploring it and extending our relationship with it we are ever making it more and more our own.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Leave out my name from the gift if it be a burden but keep my song.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Let the dead have the immortality of fame but the living the immortality of love.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Life like a child laughs shaking its rattle of death as it runs.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Man goes into the noisy crowd to drown his own clamour of silence.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The current of the world has its boundaries otherwise it could have no existence but its purpose is not shown in the boundaries which restrain it but in its movement which is toward perfection the wonder is not that there should be obstacles and sufferings in this world but that there should be law and order beauty and joy goodness and love.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The fish in the water is silent the animal on the earth is noisy the bird in the air is singing but man has in him the silence of the sea the noise of the earth and the music of the air.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Time is a wealth of change but the clock in its parody makes it mere change and no wealth.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: From the solemn gloom of the temple children run out to sit in the dust god watches them play and forgets the priest.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: A great mind and a great heart go together.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Birth is from th mystery of night into the greater mystery of day.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The tree is of today the flower is old it brings with it the message of the immemorial seed.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: God's worlds is ever renewed by death a titan's ever crushed by its own existence.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Beauty knows to say enough barbarism clamours for still more.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The picture a memory of light treasured by the shadow.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The reed waits for his master's breath the master goes seeking for his reed.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: God in his temple of stars waits for man to bring him his lamp.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Child thou bringest to my hear the babble of the wind and the water the flower's speechless secrets the cloud's dreams the mute gaze of wonder of the morning sky.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Let the evening forgive the mistake of the day and thus win peace for herself.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The grass survives the hill through its resurrections from countless deaths.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: We live in this world when we love it.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: You will be remembered for creating a page in the history of the nation.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: An unknown flower in a strange land speaks to the poet are we not of the same soil my lover.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: To the blind pen the hand that writes is unreal it's writing unmeaning.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: When I stand before thee at the day's end thou shalt see my scars and know that I had my wounds and also my healing.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: My last salutations are to them who knew me imperfect and loved me.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: When death comes and whispers to me the days are ended let me say to him, I have lived in love and not in mere time he will ask will thy songs remain I shall say I know not but this I know that often then I sang I found my eternity.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The whole universe is friendly to us and conspires to give the best to those who dream and work.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Enlightened citizenship has three components : education with value system, religion transforming into spiritual force, and creating economic prosperity through development.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: One cannot stop at thinking and asking questions. There is need to act to solve the problems and that requires hard work and perseverance.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Creativity and imagination of the human mind would always be superior to any computer”.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Education is an endless journey through knowledge and enlightenment.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Can we make an education system which will retain the smiles on the faces of our children?.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: It is through the process of innovation that knowledge is converted into wealth.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Beautiful minds are the source of creativity.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Creativity is the foundation of human thinking and will always be at the highest end of the value chain.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Encourage all children to dream for themselves. Unless they have dreams they will not be motivated to attain them.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Learning gives creativity Creativity leads to thinking Thinking provides knowledge Knowledge makes you great.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Every mind is creative, every mind is inquisitive.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The precious asset of a country is the skill, ingenuity and imagination of its people.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Thinking is progress Non-thinking is destruction Thinking leads to action.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Knowledge without action is useless and irrelevant Knowledge with action brings prosperity.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: What was thought impossible has happened and what is thought possible has not yet happened but it certainly will happen.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The education system has a tremendous responsibility to transform a child into a leader – the transformation from ‘What can you do for me’ to ‘What can I do for you’.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Conscience is a great ledger where our offences are booked and registered.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The most important part of education is to imbibe among the students the spirit of ‘we can do it’.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Hard work and perseverance are beautiful angels who will reside on your shoulders.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The ‘dream-thought-action’ philosophy is what I would like to be inculcated in each and every student.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: An ignited mind is the most powerful resource on the earth, above the earth and under the earth.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The three key societal members who can make a difference are father, mother and teacher.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Once taught, children become conscience keepers.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Education and values imparted in childhood are more important than the education received in college and university.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: In a society we have to build righteousness among all its constituents.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The twenty-first century is about the management of all the knowledge and information we have generated and the value addition that we can bring to it.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Science and spiritualism seek the same divine blessings for doing good for the people.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Enlightened leadership is all about empowerment.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: In whatever field we work, we have to remain in the service of the common man whose well-being is central to all human knowledge and endeavour.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Our righteous toil is our guiding light If we work hard we all can prosper Nurture great thoughts rise up in actions May righteous methods be our guide.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Creativity is seeing the same thing as everybody else, but thinking of out-of-the-box solutions.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Teachers themselves should be lifelong learners.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: A virtuous man alone can use the instrument of conscience.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: I believe there is no other profession in the world that is more important to society than that of a teacher.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: A candle loses nothing by lighting another candle.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Conscience is the divine light of the soul that burns within the chambers of our psychological heart.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: A teacher’s life lights many lamps.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: What matters in this life more than winning for ourselves, is helping others win.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: A teacher has to create a lifelong autonomous learner.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Teachers have a great mission to ignite the minds of the young.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The convergence of science and technology with spirituality is touted to be the future for both science and technology, and spirituality.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Quality leaders are like magnets, they attract the best people.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: When a leader empowers the people, such leaders are created who can change the course of the nation itself.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Coming into contact with a good book and possessing it is an everlasting enrichment of life.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Give one hour a day exclusively for book reading and in a few years you will become a knowledge centre.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Science is all about asking questions and finding the right answers through hard work and research into laws of nature.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Music is a great communication and language can never be a barrier.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Keep asking questions till you get satisfactory answers.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Authors act as conscience keepers of the society.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Music and dance can be used as an instrument for ensuring global peace and act as a binding force.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The crowning glory of a nation is its thinkers.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: It is the privilege of authors that they can help mankind endure adversities and succeed in life.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Creative leadership is exercising the task to change the traditional role from commander to coach, from manager to mentor, from director to delegator and from one who demands respect to one who facilitates self-respect.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Learning needs freedom to think and freedom to imagine, and both have to be facilitated by the teacher.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Music and dance elevate you to a different plane altogether and give you a breeze of happiness and peace.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: A combination of knowledge, enthusiasm and hard work of the youth is a great dynamic fire for transforming the nation.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: A nation is great because of the way its people think.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: If India is to become developed by 2020, it will do so only by riding on the shoulders of the young.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Literature elevates the mind.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The young population of India must have a big aim, small aim is a crime.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: All of us need to think and realise that the nation is greater than any one individual or organization.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: We should all create a nation that is one of the best places to live in on this earth and which brings smiles to a billion faces.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Strength respects strength.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: It is not a disgrace to not reach the stars, but it is a disgrace to have no stars to reach for.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Only when each and every citizen has been empowered so that he can lead a fulfilled life with dignity, will there be national peace and prosperity.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: All of us have to work hard and do everything possible to make our behaviour civilized to protect the rights of every individual.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Repeating what we did before for several decades with more of the same may not be the way to proceed further.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Encompassing the needs , rights and expectations of youth to the centrestage of development should be our priority.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Not only does the teacher provide knowledge, but the teacher also shapes the student’s life with great dreams and aims.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The role of the teacher is like the proverbial ‘ladder’ – it is used by everyone to climb up in life – but the ladder stays in its place.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Science is the best boon that God has bestowed upon mankind.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: A good sign of a developed nation is that ‘people who have’ work hard to bridge the divide between themselves and ‘those who have not’.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: From the emperor down to the common man, the cultivation of the righteous life is the foundation for all.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: At the frontier, there are no borders.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: A good book is a source of great knowledge and wealth for many generations.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: We have a right and responsibility to leave a positive legacy to the posterity for which we all will be remembered.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Technology is the non-linear tool available to humanity which can effect fundamental changes in the ground rules of economic competitiveness.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Our sweat will transform Developing India into a Developed India.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Transformation is an outcome of a farsighted vision, innovative mind and guiding spirit.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Art helps to bring out the beauty of life in its noblest forms, imparting meaning and depth to human existence, justifying and vindicating the purpose for which life was evolved.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Children and youth are the picture of a nation’s future. They are our hope for tomorrow.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: The science that we work with today must have the innovativeness, foresight and the vision for it to be the centre of technology that we develop tomorrow.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Focus of the education system should be to train students to become autonomous learners.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Enlightened spiritual and scientific leaders all converge towards giving reverence to human life.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Science and science pursuits are borderless.

item.title: Inspiring Thoughts
item.description: Where the mind is without fear and the head is held high, Where knowledge is free, Where the world has not been broken up into fragments by narrow domestic walls, Where words come out from the depth of truth, Where tireless striving stretches its arms towards perfection, Where the clear stream of reason has not lost its way into the dreary desert sand of dead habit, Where the mind is led forward by thee into ever-widening thought and action, Into that heaven of freedom, my father, let my country awake.
